channel.title: My first try!
channel.description:
Well, it's my first try at a sig, not to good, tell me what i could improve, whats good, whats good but could be better. CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM!
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img168.imageshack.us/img168/6148/hey3211copyfc8.jpg[/img][/URL]
Edit: Thanks Syberium for adding the pic!

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @Tuldah Tuldah
item.description:
@Tuldah wrote:

Ya needs some work.I dont like that text!Make it creative.And the text doesnt fit very good.Part of the text goes out of its box.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

hey321 try and follow me here,

Step 1
Open the render(picture) up and select everything that ISN’T the picture with the magic wand thing.(I forget the name of it :s)
Then right click on the picture and press selection inverse or what ever.

Step 2
Change to your moving mouse thing.(I really don’t remember the names, this is coming right from my mind.)
And click and HOLD DOWN the mouse, and drag it onto your ‘soon to be’ picture thats probably on another section of ps.

Step 3
Add the background you wish(BEHIND YOUR RENDER…)
and special effects like that.

Step 4
Add your name and such, make it unique :s
Don’t use arial, it only looks good if you tamper with it, go to DaFont and pick a unique text, but nothing curly -.-

Step 5
Blend your layers. try to make the colors work together.
Make it looks good using the large variety of tools you have/can download.

Step 6
Save it!
I like to use .png, it gives good quality
Then upload it and show use what your have accomplished.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

hey321:

Ah, but just because its long and painstaking, doesn’t mean i don’t learn anything.

Ah well, don;t listen to me. I work better getting a few tips here and there from tutorials. I learn better that way but if you find you learn better with trial and error, then by all means, go for it.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

hey321:

You do realize that you learn the most when you try to make something? I figured out the gradiant (sp?) and text because i tried to make one using it. I don’t use tutorials unless i’m REALLY helpless. I mean, what’s the point of living life if you get instructions from someone else on how to do it?

You don’t have to follow a tutorial exactly. But sometimes learning from your mistakes can be a long and painstaking effort. Just look through a few of them, pick up a few tips and try and put all that you’ve learned into a second signature.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

To be frank, its poor, even for your first try. Try reading up on a few tutorials on sexy-looking backgrounds, get some good text (www.dafont.com) and just mess about to get used to photoshop before attempting another signature.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

omg… I just noticed this was made in CS2. Even someone who knew NOTHING about photshop coul;d make a better sig. No offence, but srsly. Read up on the photoshop help file, and try using a few filters.

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @AD_LVL_7 AD LVL 7
item.description:
@AD_LVL_7 wrote:

well, open the render in paint,
make the black become white (black background)
then do the same as before; only with the new render
(with the white background)

or, adobe photoshop: use that thingy to select the background
and then paint it to white, then do the same as before; only with the new render
(with the white background)

Read full topic

item.title: My first try!
item.dc:creator: @hey321 hey321
item.description:
@hey321 wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:3, topic:58248”][quote author=mvp566 link=topic=83472.msg898055#msg898055 date=1171441831]
erm um sorry but its horrible, the render does not match… the text is what arial? and the bg is a gradient sorry but even for your first try its um sad…
[/quote]
Don’t be so harsh, tell him how to make it work,
Delete the black around the render, Make a more unique background, and use a pimpered out text xD
U can get text at dafont.com[/quote]

I didn’t get text yet :P. That’s why the text is horrible. Render came like that, how can i delete the black?

But yes, that’s somewhat what i want. If you guys tell me whats wrong ill try to fix it :P.

Read full topic
